Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Dating: 2ND INTERMEDIATE PERIOD (not after); MIDDLE KINGDOM (not before)
Category: COSMETIC AND MEDICAL EQUIPMENT AND IMPLEMENTS
Name: Vase for cosmetics
Description: Vase for cosmetics with tall body, thick discoid lip and flaring neck. The flat discoid base protrudes slightly. Around the neck there remained some fragments of a thin leather strap, intended to retain the skin which was strectched across the orifice of the vase in order to seal it. There are remains of cosmetics on the internal walls.
